newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Microsoft estimate hiked.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Microsoft estimate hiked.

text.p: - Goldman Sachs raised its earnings estimate for Microsoft Corp to $4.05 per share for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1997, from a previous estimate of $4.00, and compared with $3.40 in fiscal 1996, analyst Rick Sherlund said.
- Microsoft reported earnings of $0.95 per share for its fiscal first quarter, beating Goldman Sachs' estimate of $0.90 and about 22 percent above last year's $0.78.

- Sherlund said in a report the brokerage lowered its Microsoft EPS estimate for the current second quarter by $0.02 to $1.02 to reflect the planned deferral of income from the forthcoming Office 97 product. The deferred earnings will be recognized in second half of the fiscal year.
- Microsoft earned $0.87 a share in last year's fiscal second quarter.
